I am happy to see someone that is so qualified but unhappy that I have to wait six weeks. Posts.Title: Breast Surgeon Kelley33 Kelley33

Posts.Content: Feb 12, 2013 05:24PM Kelley33 wrote: LYCM85, I have had a lump for three years now and I've had mammos, US, chest x-ray, breast MRI, and even CT scan and it did not show up on any of those. Went to see surgeon and she said it's just normal dense tissue. This year when I went for my physical, my PCP said as she was doing my breast exam; have you had your mammo this year and had this lump checked. Well of course, I immediately began to worry again. Went for mammo and received letter stating mammo was clear but I should have clinical evaluation because not all cancers are seen on mammograms. I don't know what else I can have done other than a biospy. My paternal grandmother died of BC as well as her brother , have a aunt battling BC and my maternal grandmother had ovarian cancer. Therefore, I am always worried anytime something like this happens. I know you are worried and that's understandable. Try and not let it consume you and wishing you the best.

Posts.Content: Jan 8, 2012 08:36PM Kelley33 wrote: I am going for diagnostic mammo and possible US tomorrow. I am becoming overwhelmed with a flood of different emotions. Lately, I have been thinking about my grandmother that passed away of breast cancer. I am constantly thinking of how brave she was and how much I admire her even more now, as well as how much I miss her. I am also feeling anxious and nervous about this appointment. I went through a similar ordeal last year and everything checked out okay and now here I am one year later dealing with this again. However, this year it is more emotional for me to deal with at this point. This site is inspiring and a true blessing.
Posts.Title: Breast Pain Kelley33 JanetM

Posts.Content: Jan 10, 2012 12:12AM Kelley33 wrote: Just got back from Diagnostic Mammo and Ultrasound. Radiologist said everything looks clear. No cancer. He told me that breast pain is not common with breast cancer and if breast pain is present, it is more a of a constant pain, not a on and off pain like I have had the past 4 weeks. He told me to monitor the area and if I have any changes in the cyst or type of pain , to notify my primary doctor. I am thankful and relieved to hear it was not cancer. I want to thank everyone for their support and advice and wish everyone blessings and peace.
Posts.Title: Breast Pain Kelley33 JanetM

Posts.Content: Kelley33 wrote: Lump found in left breast last year by doc. Had the Mammo, US and MRI everything clear. Was told I have very dense and fibrocystic breasts. Fast forward one year. Started having pain in breast at site of lump, had mammo and US; both clear. Pain continued another 4 weeks. Started having pain under arm and some swelling under arm. Woke up past two mornings with numbness in left arm and pain in breast and arm. Left and arm feel different than right side. They feel heavier and just different. Went to primary doc again yesterday, suppose to have another MRI soon. If nothing shows up on MRI, she wants me to see a surgeon. I have a family history of BC. Has anyone here had these symptoms. I am very worried and am trying to stay positive. Log in to post a reply
